us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame

Class ReferenceFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame.ReferenceFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NameBasedHashCodeHolder

    public abstract class ReferenceFrame
extends java.lang.Object
implements NameBasedHashCodeHolder
    ReferenceFrame represents a reference coordinate frame.

    ReferenceFrames are organized as a tree structure. A root reference frame such worldFrame represents a global coordinate system with not parent. From this root frame, children frame, with constant or variable transforms to the root, can be added recursively to form the tree structure. This structure allows to define each reference frame with a unmodifiable parent frame and their transform, i.e, a RigidBodyTransform providing both position and orientation, with respect to that same parent frame. The transform to the root reference frame is then internally computed by computing the path from each reference frame to the root.

    The most common ways to create a new ReferenceFrame are:

    • Using one of the constructors to create either a root reference frame or a child reference frame. In both cases, the method updateTransformToParent(RigidBodyTransform) has to be overrided. When creating a root reference frame, the method should be empty, while creating a child reference frame the implementation of the method is used to update the transform of the child frame with respect to its parent.
    • Using one of the static methods to create a reference frame with an unchanging transform with respect to its parent.
    • Look for extensions of ReferenceFrame.

    Using ReferenceFrame, a geometry, such as a point, a line, or a convex polygon, can easily be expressed in its local coordinate system and then transformed to know its coordinates from another coordinate system perspective. For instance, the location of the toes of a bipedal robot can be easily determined in the local foot reference frame, then can be easily transformed to the world frame or pelvis frame to know its location from the perspective of world or the pelvis.

    ReferenceFrame is only the base class of the reference frame framework. Several classes allows for avoiding the burden of tracking to what frame a geometry is attached and how to express a geometry in a different frame.

    • Field Detail

      • parentFrame

        protected final ReferenceFrame parentFrame
        The reference to which this frame is attached to.

        The transformToParent of this describes the pose of this reference frame with respect to parentFrame.

      • nextTransformToRootID

        protected static long nextTransformToRootID

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReferenceFrame

        public ReferenceFrame(java.lang.String frameName)
        Creates a new root reference frame.

        Please use the method constructARootFrame(String) instead. This is to use only when extending this class.

        Most of the time, worldFrame is the only root frame from which children reference frames are added.

        Note that frames added as children of this root frame belongs to a different reference frame tree than the tree starting off of worldFrame. Transformation across two different trees of reference frames is forbidden as the transformation between them is undefined.

        The parent frame and transforms of a root frame are all null.

        Parameters:
        frameName - the name of the new world frame.

      • ReferenceFrame

        public ReferenceFrame(java.lang.String frameName,
                      ReferenceFrame parentFrame)
        Creates a new reference frame defined as being a child of the given parentFrame.

        This new reference frame defined in the parentFrame and moves with it.

        Its pose with respect to the parentFrame can be modified at runtime by changing the transform in the method updateTransformToParent(RigidBodyTransform) when overriding it.

        This new reference frame is not a stationary frame, i.e. it is assumed to be potentially moving with respect to the root frame. It is also not expected to have its z-axis aligned at all time with the z-axis of the root frame.

        Parameters:
        frameName - the name of the new frame.
        parentFrame - the parent frame of the new reference frame.

      • ReferenceFrame

        public ReferenceFrame(java.lang.String frameName,
                      ReferenceFrame parentFrame,
                      boolean isAStationaryFrame,
                      boolean isZupFrame)
        Creates a new reference frame defined as being a child of the given parentFrame.

        This new reference frame defined in the parentFrame and moves with it.

        Its pose with respect to the parentFrame can be modified at runtime by changing the transform in the method updateTransformToParent(RigidBodyTransform) when overriding it.

        Parameters:
        frameName - the name of the new frame.
        parentFrame - the parent frame of the new reference frame.
        isAStationaryFrame - refers to whether this new frame is stationary with respect to the root frame or moving. If true, the parentFrame has to also be stationary.
        isZupFrame - refers to whether this new frame has its z-axis aligned with the root frame at all time or not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if isAStationaryFrame is true and the parentFrame is not a stationary frame.

      • ReferenceFrame

        public ReferenceFrame(java.lang.String frameName,
                      ReferenceFrame parentFrame,
                      us.ihmc.euclid.transform.RigidBodyTransform transformToParent)
        Creates a new reference frame defined as being a child of the given parentFrame and initializes the transform to its parent.

        The transformFromParent should describe the pose of the new frame expressed in its parent frame.

        This new reference frame defined in the parentFrame and moves with it.

        Its pose with respect to the parentFrame can be modified at runtime by changing the transform in the method updateTransformToParent(RigidBodyTransform) when overriding it.

        This new reference frame is not a stationary frame, i.e. it is assumed to be potentially moving with respect to the root frame. It is also not expected to have its z-axis aligned at all time with the z-axis of the root frame.

        Parameters:
        frameName - the name of the new frame.
        parentFrame - the parent frame of the new reference frame.
        transformToParent - the transform that can be used to transform a geometry object the new frame to its parent frame. Not modified.

      • ReferenceFrame

        public ReferenceFrame(java.lang.String frameName,
                      ReferenceFrame parentFrame,
                      us.ihmc.euclid.transform.RigidBodyTransform transformToParent,
                      boolean isAStationaryFrame,
                      boolean isZupFrame)
        Creates a new reference frame defined as being a child of the given parentFrame and initializes the transform to its parent.

        The transformFromParent should describe the pose of the new frame expressed in its parent frame.

        This new reference frame defined in the parentFrame and moves with it.

        Its pose with respect to the parentFrame can be modified at runtime by changing the transform in the method updateTransformToParent(RigidBodyTransform) when overriding it.

        Parameters:
        frameName - the name of the new frame.
        parentFrame - the parent frame of the new reference frame.
        transformToParent - the transform that can be used to transform a geometry object the new frame to its parent frame. Not modified.
        isAStationaryFrame - refers to whether this new frame is stationary with respect to the root frame or moving. If true, the parentFrame has to also be stationary.
        isZupFrame - refers to whether this new frame has its z-axis aligned with the root frame at all time or not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if isAStationaryFrame is true and the parentFrame is not a stationary frame.

    • Method Detail

      • constructARootFrame

        public static ReferenceFrame constructARootFrame(java.lang.String frameName)
        Construct a new z-up root reference frame.

        Most of the time, worldFrame is the only root frame from which children reference frames are added.

        Note that frames added as children of this root frame belongs to a different reference frame tree than the tree starting off of worldFrame. Transformation across two different trees of reference frames is forbidden as the transformation between them is undefined.

        The parent frame and transforms of a root frame are all null.

        Parameters:
        frameName - the name of the new world frame.
        Returns:
        the new non-moving z-up root reference frame.

      • constructFrameWithUnchangingTransformFromParent

        public static ReferenceFrame constructFrameWithUnchangingTransformFromParent(java.lang.String frameName,
                                                                             ReferenceFrame parentFrame,
                                                                             us.ihmc.euclid.transform.RigidBodyTransform transformFromParent)
        Creates a reference frame with an immutable transform from its parent.

        The transformFromParent should describe the pose of the parent frame expressed in this new frame.

        Parameters:
        frameName - the name of the new frame.
        parentFrame - the parent frame of the new reference frame.
        transformFromParent - the transform that can be used to transform a geometry object from the parent frame to this frame. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the new reference frame.

      • constructFrameWithUnchangingTranslationFromParent

        public static ReferenceFrame constructFrameWithUnchangingTranslationFromParent(java.lang.String frameName,
                                                                               ReferenceFrame parentFrame,
                                                                               us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Tuple3DReadOnly translationOffsetFromParent)
        Creates a reference frame with an immutable translation offset from its parent.

        The new reference frame has the same orientation as its parent frame.

        Parameters:
        frameName - the name of the new frame.
        parentFrame - the parent frame of the new reference frame.
        translationOffsetFromParent - describes the position of the new reference frame's origin expressed in the parent frame. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the new reference frame.

                                                                           ReferenceFrame parentFrame,
                                                                           us.ihmc.euclid.transform.RigidBodyTransform transformToParent)
        Creates a reference frame with an immutable transform to its parent.

        The transformToParent should describe the pose of the new frame expressed in its parent frame.

        Parameters:
        frameName - the name of the new frame.
        parentFrame - the parent frame of the new reference frame.
        transformToParent - the transform that can be used to transform a geometry object the new frame to its parent frame. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the new reference frame.

      • getWorldFrame

        public static ReferenceFrame getWorldFrame()
        Return the world reference frame that is a root reference frame.

        The world reference frame can be used to create child reference frames. It is usually assumed that the z-axis represents the up/down direction (parallel to gravity), the x-axis represents the forward/backward direction and the y-axis represents the transversal direction.

        Returns:
        the world reference frame.

      • isWorldFrame

        public boolean isWorldFrame()
        Tests if this reference frame is worldFrame.
        Returns:
        true if this is worldFrame, false otherwise.

      • isAStationaryFrame

        public boolean isAStationaryFrame()
        Tests if this reference frame is to be considered as stationary frame, i.e. not moving with respect to its root frame.
        Returns:
        true if this is a stationary frame, false other.

      • isZupFrame

        public boolean isZupFrame()
        Tests if this reference frame is considered to have its z-axis aligned with the root frame.
        Returns:
        true if this is a z-up frame, false otherwise.

      • update

        public void update()
        The user must call update each tick. It will then call updateTransformToParent(RigidBodyTransform) which should be overridden to indicate how the transform to each frame's parent should be updated.

        Note that it is not necessary to call update on reference frames with an unchanging transform to parent, even if the parent frame is moving.

      • updateTransformToParent

        protected abstract void updateTransformToParent(us.ihmc.euclid.transform.RigidBodyTransform transformToParent)
        Override this method to define how this reference frame should be located with respect to its parent frame over time by setting the argument transformToParent.

        The transformFromParent should describe the pose of this frame expressed in its parent frame.

        Parameters:
        transformToParent - the transform to updated according to how this reference frame should now positioned with respect to its parent frame. Modified.

      • getParent

        public ReferenceFrame getParent()
        Returns the parent frame of this reference frame.

        Note that a root frame has no parent frame, such that this method returns null if this is a root frame.

        Returns:
        the parent frame of this reference frame.

      • getRootFrame

        public ReferenceFrame getRootFrame()
        Retrieves the root frame of the tree of reference frame that this frame belongs to.
        Returns:
        the root frame.

      • getTransformToParent

        public us.ihmc.euclid.transform.RigidBodyTransform getTransformToParent()
        Returns a copy of this reference frame's transform to parent.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        This transform can be applied to a vector defined in this frame in order to obtain the equivalent vector in the parent frame.

        Returns:
        a copy of the transform to the parent frame.

      • getTransformToParent

        public void getTransformToParent(us.ihmc.euclid.transform.RigidBodyTransform transformToPack)
        packs this reference frame's transform to parent into the given transform transformToPack.

        This transform can be applied to a vector defined in this frame in order to obtain the equivalent vector in the parent frame.

        Parameters:
        transformToPack - the transform in which this frame's transform to its parent frame is stored. Modified.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of this reference frame.

        Reference frames usually have a unique name among the reference frames in the same tree but this is not guaranteed.

        Returns:
        this frame's name.

        Returns:
        the transform from this frame to the worldFrame.

        public void transformFromThisToDesiredFrame(ReferenceFrame desiredFrame,
                                            us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable objectToTransform)
        Transforms the given objectToTransform by the transform from this reference frame to the given desiredFrame.

        This method can be used to change the reference frame in which objectToTransform is expressed from this to desiredFrame.

        Parameters:
        desiredFrame - the target frame for the transformation.
        objectToTransform - the object to apply the transformation on. Modified.

      • checkReferenceFrameMatch

        public void checkReferenceFrameMatch(ReferenceFrameHolder referenceFrameHolder)
                              throws ReferenceFrameMismatchException
        Checks if the query holds onto this reference frame.

        This is usually used from verifying that a geometry is expressed in a specific frame.

        Parameters:
        referenceFrameHolder - the query holding a reference frame.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if the query holds onto a different frame than this.

      • checkIsAZUpFrame

        public void checkIsAZUpFrame()
                      throws java.lang.RuntimeException

        Throws:

      • getNameBasedHashCode

        public long getNameBasedHashCode()
        Gets the value of this frame's name based hash code.

        This is a secondary unique hash code representing this reference frame that is computed based on frameName and the parent frame name if any.

        This hash code has the benefit of remaining the same when creating several instances of the same tree of reference frames, such that it can be used to serialize and deserialize frame information.

        Specified by:
        getNameBasedHashCode in interface NameBasedHashCodeHolder
        Returns:
        this frame's name based hash code.

      • getAdditionalNameBasedHashCode

        public long getAdditionalNameBasedHashCode()
        Gets the value of this frame's custom hash code.

        Somewhat of a hack that allows to enforce two frames that are physically the same but with different names to have the same hash code or to enforce a common frame to have a specific hash code that can be known without holding on its actual instance.

        Returns:
        the name based hash code for this reference frame.

      • setAdditionalNameBasedHashCode

        public void setAdditionalNameBasedHashCode(long additionalNameBasedHashCode)
        Sets this frame's custom hash code's value.

        Somewhat of a hack that allows to enforce two frames that are physically the same but with different names to have the same hash code or to enforce a common frame to have a specific hash code that can be known without holding on its actual instance.

        Parameters:
        additionalNameBasedHashCode - the new value of this frame's custom hash code.
